name: Phytolacca
Relationship: Inimical: MERCUR.Compare: Tincture of PHYTOLACCA BERRY (sore throats and in the treatment of obesity); BRY.; RHUS; KALI-HYD.; MERC.; SANG.; ARUM TRIPH.Antidotes: Milk and salt; BELLAD.; MEZER.

Urine: Scanty, suppressed, with pain in kidney region
Head: Scaly eruption on scalp
Pressure in temples and over eyes
Brain feels sore
Pain from frontal region backward
Vertigo on rising
Rheumatism of scalp; pains come on every time it rains
Fever: High fever, alternating with chilliness and great prostration
Abdomen: Bruised feeling through epigastrium and abdomen
Constipation of the aged and those with weak heart
Mouth: Teeth clenched; low lip drawn down; lips everted; jaws firmly set; chin drawn down on sternum
Teething children with irresistible desire to bite the teeth together
Tongue red tip, feels rough and scalded; bleeding from mouth; blisters on side
Mapped, indented, fissured, with yellow patch down center
Respiratory: Difficult breathing; dry hacking, tickling cough; worse at night
Aching pains in chest, through mid-sternum; with cough
Nose: Coryza; flow of mucus from one nostril and from posterior nares
Heart: Feeling as if heart leaped into throat
Shock of pain in cardiac region alternating with pain in right arm
Mind: Loss of personal delicacy, disregard of surrounding objects
Back: Aching pains in lumbar region; pains streaking up and down spine into sacrum
Back stiff, especially in morning on rising and during damp weather
Weakness and dull pain in region of kidneys
Female: Breast is hard, painful and of purple hue
Tumors of the breasts with enlarged axillary glands
When child nurses, pain goes from nipple all over body
Cracks and small ulcers about nipples
Irritable breasts, before and during menses
Mastitis; mammae hard and very sensitive
Skin: Most useful in early stages of cutaneous diseases
Disposition to boils, and when sloughing occurs
Throat: Tension and pressure in parotid gland
Much pain at root of tongue; soft palate and tonsils swollen
Quinsy; tonsils and fauces swollen, with burning pain; cannot swallow even water
Ulcerated sore throat and diphtheria; throat feels very hot; pain at root of tongue extending to ear
Tonsils swollen, especially right; dark-red appearance
Shooting pain into ears on swallowing
Pseudo-membranous exudation, grayish-white; thick, tenacious yellowish mucus, difficult to dislodge
Sensation of a lump in throat
Extremities: Feet puffed; pain in ankles and feet
Pain in under side of thighs
Pain in legs, patient dreads to get up
Pains fly like electric shocks, shooting, lancinating, shifting rapidly
Aching of heels; relieved by elevating feet
Shooting pain in right shoulder, with stiffness and inability to raise arm

details: Aching, soreness, restlessness, prostration, are general symptoms guiding to Phytolacca. Pre-eminently a glandular remedy. Glandular swellings with heat and inflammation. Has a powerful effect on fibrous and osseous tissues; fasciae and muscle sheaths; acts on scar tissue. Syphilitic bone pains; chronic rheumatism. Sore throat, quinsy, and diphtheria. Tetanus and opisthotonos. Decrease of weight. Retarded dentition.
dosage: Tincture, to third potency. Externally for mastitis.
